definitions.text: proper alignment; the property possessed by something that is in correct or proper alignment
make level, square, balanced, or concentric
examples: true up the cylinder of an engine

definitions.text: consistent with fact or reality; not false; ; - B. Russell
examples: it is undesirable to believe a proposition when there is no ground whatever for supposing it true
the true meaning of the statement

definitions.text: devoted (sometimes fanatically) to a cause or concept or truth
examples: true believers bonded together against all who disagreed with them

definitions.text: expressing or given to expressing the truth

examples: the horseshoe crab is not a true crab
Pythagoras was the first true mathematician
he was true to his word
I would be true for there are those who trust me

definitions.text: not pretended; sincerely felt or expressed
examples: her interest in people was unfeigned
a spirit which true men have always admired

definitions.text: determined with reference to the earth's axis rather than the magnetic poles

examples: the window frame isn't quite true
true, she is the smartest in her class
